page.syntax: Context.Session.SaveFileToSessionFile as L (SourceFile as C, Key as C, RemoveAfterFirstRetrieval as L = .T.)

argument.name: SourceName as C
argument.description: The full path of the file whose contents are to be saved into the session-state collection.

argument.name: Key as C
argument.description: The key for the data in the session-state collection. The value of key is a file name without any path components.

argument.name: RemoveAfterFirstRetrieval as T
argument.description: This is reserved for future use.

page.description: Saves source file content to the session-state collection under IIS.
page.discussion: Context.Session.SaveFileToSessionFile() saves the contents of the source file to the session-state collection under IIS. Under the stand-alone application server, the source file is copied to disk in the stand-alone application server's session folder. Check Context.Session.CallResult.Success before using the return value.
